intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. polymeres, commonly known as the golden buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers with 5 to 15 petals, which bloom from late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are palmately lobed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, often found in meadows, woodland edges, and wetlands. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ecological restoration projects.
